title: Go Core Path: Zero-to-Senior (120 Katas)
description: Structured Go learning from first-programming fundamentals to senior-level concurrency, reliability, and design.

categories.title: Starter: Programming Essentials
categories.description: Zero-to-code foundations for learners new to programming and Go.
categories.learning_goal: Understand functions, conditionals, loops, and boundaries so you can turn plain rules into working code.

categories.title: Starter: Data and Logic
categories.description: Practical beginner problems using slices, maps, structs, and search/filter logic.
categories.learning_goal: Build confidence with common data operations and predictable return contracts before tackling larger systems.

categories.title: Go Foundations
categories.description: Core syntax, control flow, and deterministic behavior with everyday coding patterns.
categories.learning_goal: Convert plain-language requirements into clear, testable Go functions that handle edge cases intentionally.

categories.title: Core Collections and Algorithms
categories.description: Slices, maps, generics, and algorithmic thinking for correctness under constraints.
categories.learning_goal: Use Go data structures and iteration patterns to solve problems without sacrificing readability or safety.

categories.title: Text, Data, and Transformations
categories.description: Parsing, formatting, and data transformation across structured and unstructured inputs.
categories.learning_goal: Design robust input/output behavior that is explicit about malformed data and contract guarantees.

categories.title: File, Time, and Config
categories.description: File handling, time-based behavior, and configuration safety in local systems.
categories.learning_goal: Handle operating-system boundaries and time-sensitive logic with predictable, testable behavior.

categories.title: Services and Boundaries
categories.description: HTTP, networking, middleware, and service composition across unstable external boundaries.
categories.learning_goal: Treat I/O boundaries as contracts and return safe behavior under failure and partial success.

categories.title: Concurrency and Reliability
categories.description: Lifecycle ownership, cancellation, coordination primitives, and resilient runtime behavior.
categories.learning_goal: Build concurrent systems that stay correct under load, interruption, and timing variance.

categories.title: Tooling, Security, and Advanced Design
categories.description: CLI tools, cryptography, testing discipline, performance, generics, reflection, and architecture.
categories.learning_goal: Apply production-grade quality standards and design tradeoff reasoning to senior-level Go solutions.
